comment.body:
`/Me.ZeroNetwork.bit`
`/ZeroMedia.bit`
You are just one slash way.
There is no private data in the P2P architecture, since every part of what you see is shared by everyone. The content of ZeroMail is also shared by everyone, but encrypted.
@Sick Bird: Bwoi Analytic is planned, but the [site](/bwoi.bit) has not been updated since the end of last month.
Why not add a Let's Encrypt certificate?
@RiotPulv: I don't think you have to include your port in the certificate. (e.g. https://5.101.103.222:43110/ https://bit.no.com:43110)
ZeroRevision: Free, Decentralized and Anonymous essay proofread service.
